revised_title: The Metabolic Pathways of Potato Tubers: Carbon Dioxide Production and Lactic Acid Content
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on potato tubers to study the relationship between carbon dioxide production and lactic acid content after periods of anaerobic conditions. They found that the increased carbon dioxide production in the after-effect was derived from two main sources: the oxidation of lactic acid and the respiration of sugar. The results confirm previous observations and provide further insight into the metabolic pathways in plant tissues.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
